abstract.p: Auberge Resorts is now offering pet beds, which are changed daily and turned down nightly, and room service doggy menu; photo (S)

block.p: Picture a hotel room where you sleep on a sage, copper or nutmeg velvet bed fitted with orthopedic pads, a down-filled cushion and Rivolta Carmignani sheets from Italy. A knock tells you your beef sirloin patty has just arrived. Now picture the recipient of these amenities -- not you, but your dog.

Realizing that pleasing pets can be as important as pleasing people, Auberge Resorts (www.aubergeresorts.com) is now offering pet beds, above right, which are changed daily and turned down nightly, and room service doggy menu -- which includes diced chicken with pasta and ground beef with rice along with that sirloin.
Resorts are realizing that pleasing pets can be as important as pleasing people.

Picture a hotel room where you sleep on a sage, copper or nutmeg velvet bed fitted with orthopedic pads, a down-filled cushion and Rivolta Carmignani sheets from Italy. A knock tells you your beef sirloin patty has just arrived. Now picture the recipient of these amenities -- not you, but your dog.

Realizing that pleasing pets can be as important as pleasing people, Auberge Resorts (www.aubergeresorts.com) is now offering pet beds, above right, which are changed daily and turned down nightly, and room service doggy menu -- which includes diced chicken with pasta and ground beef with rice along with that sirloin.

These are available at Calistoga Ranch in Napa Valley, Calif; the Esperanza in Cabo San Lucas, Mexico; and the Inn at Palmetto Bluff in Bluffton, S.C. To ensure your pet's privacy, you will also receive a ''Do Not Disturb Doggie'' sign.
